itemDescription: English woman, celebrated figure of an Irish legal case

wikipedia_page.main: Theresa Yelverton (née Maria Theresa Longworth;  c. 1827–33 – 13 September 1881) was an English writer who became notorious because of her involvement in the Yelverton case, a 19th-century Irish law case, which eventually resulted in a change to the law on mixed religion marriages in Ireland.

response: In 1867, Stoddard converted to Catholicism. In 1869, he became good friends with travel writer Theresa Yelverton.Chloë Schama, Wild Romance: A Victorian Story (New York: Walker & Company), 151-153
* Theresa Yelverton (1830s–1881), English woman involved in the Yelverton case

Theresa Yelverton, a party to the Yelverton case, lived as a child at Merryfield House, at the corner of Queens Road and Smedley Road, overlooking the Irk Valley.T. Swindells, Manchester Streets and Manchester Men, 1906
